skill.name: visual-qa
skill.description: Complete visual QA - screenshots with full-page scroll to trigger animations, then analyze with Claude. Run after CSS/template changes.
skill.summary: Automated visual QA with full-page scroll for GSAP animations, multi-device screenshots, and Claude-powered analysis
skill.author: CrazySwami

security_audit.summary: Static scanner flagged 43 potential issues, but all are false positives. The skill uses Playwright for legitimate visual QA automation. Hardcoded URLs are documentation examples, file operations are standard screenshot output handling, and there is no cryptographic code or dangerous operations.

content.value_statement: Manual visual testing is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates full-page screenshots with proper animation handling across multiple devices, then enables Claude to analyze the results for visual regressions.
actual_capabilities: Scrolls through entire page in increments to trigger all GSAP and ScrollTrigger animations before capturing screenshots
Captures screenshots at 10 different viewport sizes including desktop, tablet, and mobile devices
Takes full-page screenshots that include content below the fold
Launches parallel Haiku sub-agents to analyze multiple pages simultaneously
Stores screenshots in configurable output directories for review
limitations: Requires Playwright and Chromium browser to be installed on the system
Cannot test authenticated pages or pages requiring login credentials
Does not perform visual regression comparison against baseline images automatically
Animation timing is fixed and may need adjustment for pages with very slow animations

use_cases.title: Web Developer Checking Visual Changes
use_cases.description: After making CSS or template changes, run visual QA to capture all pages across devices and verify nothing is broken before deploying.

use_cases.title: QA Engineer Performing Visual Regression Testing
use_cases.description: Capture screenshots of a website at multiple breakpoints and use Claude to review them for layout issues, missing images, or animation problems.
use_cases.target_user: QA engineers and quality assurance specialists

use_cases.title: Designer Reviewing Responsive Designs
use_cases.description: Quickly generate screenshots across all device sizes to verify that responsive designs work correctly without manually testing each viewport.
use_cases.target_user: UI/UX designers and design QA teams

prompt_templates.title: Basic Visual QA
prompt_templates.prompt: Run visual QA on [URL] and analyze the screenshots for any visual issues.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick visual check of a single page

prompt_templates.title: Full Site Visual Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run visual QA on all pages of [website]. Take screenshots at all breakpoints and review each one for visual issues like broken images, layout problems, or animation failures.
prompt_templates.scenario: Complete visual audit of an entire website

prompt_templates.title: Mobile-First Testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Take mobile screenshots of [URL] and check for touch target sizes, text readability, and layout issues on small screens.

prompt_templates.title: Animation Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Run visual QA on [URL] and specifically check that all GSAP ScrollTrigger animations completed properly. Look for elements that should be animated but appear in their initial state.

output_examples.input: Run visual QA on the home page
Check the about page for animation issues
output: - Hero section: Hero text visible at final opacity, loaded correctly
- Team photos: All team member photos loaded, grayscale filter applied
- Scroll animations: All scroll-card elements triggered properly
- All links and buttons styled correctly

best_practices: Run visual QA after any CSS, JavaScript, or template changes before deploying
Use the checklist in SKILL.md to systematically review each page for common issues
Run parallel analysis with multiple Haiku agents when testing many pages to save time
anti_patterns: Running visual QA without first checking that the development server is accessible
Not waiting for animations to complete before taking screenshots
Skipping the mobile viewport sizes when testing responsive designs

faq.question: What browsers does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill uses Chromium via Playwright. This provides consistent screenshot rendering across runs.

faq.question: Can I test pages behind authentication?
faq.answer: The current version does not support authenticated pages. The skill is designed for publicly accessible pages.

faq.question: How long does visual QA take?
faq.answer: Time varies by page count and animation complexity. A typical 6-page site with 10 viewports takes 2-5 minutes.

faq.question: Where are screenshots saved?
faq.answer: By default, screenshots are saved to /root/screenshots. You can specify a custom output directory with the --output flag.

faq.question: What animation types are handled?
faq.answer: The skill specifically handles GSAP and ScrollTrigger animations by scrolling through the entire page in increments.

faq.question: Can I test a single viewport size?
faq.answer: The script captures all viewport sizes. You can filter the results after screenshots are taken or modify the script for specific testing needs.
